content.description: In the circuit shown above, the switch <math alttext="S" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is open, the capacitor is uncharged, and the current through the battery is <math alttext="0.5 amp" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mrow><mn>0.5</mn><mtext> </mtext><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>.
content.question: At what time is the current through the resistor in the middle branch <math alttext="0.5 amps" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>0.5</mn><mtext> </mtext><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>?

choices.label: Immediately after the switch is closed
When the circuit has reached steady state
Sometime between when the switch is closed and steady state is reached

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
